abstract_summ: In this paper, we present an innovative solution for fake news detection that utilizes deep learning methods.We survey the issue of opinion spamming and fake review detection and focus on both sides of fake review groups, i.e., how to detect such groups but also how to set up a group that might be undetected with current methods.We have built a classifier to detect fake news and present results for the automatic fake news detection and its class.Experiments on a real-world Twitter dataset demonstrate that our proposed models achieve much better performance than state-of-the-art methods both on the rumor detection task and early detection task.In terms of results interesting patterns are obtained that relate the size and subtle changes of the real news to create fake news.

title_abstract_phrases: In this paper, we present an innovative solution for fake news detection that utilizes deep learning methods.We survey the issue of opinion spamming and fake review detection and focus on both sides of fake review groups, i.e., how to detect such groups but also how to set up a group that might be undetected with current methods.Experiments on a real-world Twitter dataset demonstrate that our proposed models achieve much better performance than state-of-the-art methods both on the rumor detection task and early detection task.However, there are users who tend to share false information, who can be characterised as potential fake news spreaders.Experiments on real-world rumour datasets show that our BERT-based model can achieve effective early rumour detection and significantly outperform start-of-the-art rumour detection models.
